title: 2018 Audi R8 V10 Plus Coupe Competition Package
description: This 2018 Audi R8 V10 Plus coupe is one of 10 equipped from the factory with the $34,175 Competition Package, all of which were finished in Suzuka Gray Metallic over Black Nappa leather. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed S tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes the Black Optic and Full Leather packages as well as 20" Audi Sport wheels, ceramic-composite brakes, a fixed carbon-fiber rear wing, Carbon Sigma side blades, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and Audi Virtual Cockpit. The car remained with the original owner in North Carolina until 2025, and it now has under 6k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this R8 Competition is now offered in Georgia with a screenshot of the window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2018 Audi R8 V10 Plus Coupe Competition Package at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #195,872.
text: This 2018 Audi R8 V10 Plus coupe is one of 10 equipped from the factory with the $34,175 Competition Package, all of which were finished in Suzuka Gray Metallic over Black Nappa leather. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed S tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes the Black Optic and Full Leather packages as well as 20″ Audi Sport wheels, ceramic-composite brakes, a fixed carbon-fiber rear wing, Carbon Sigma side blades, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and Audi Virtual Cockpit. The car remained with the original owner in North Carolina until 2025, and it now has under 6k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this R8 Competition is now offered in Georgia with a screenshot of the window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title. The Competition Package added a carbon-fiber aero kit with extended side sills, front dive planes, a front spoiler, a rear diffuser, and a fixed rear wing. All Competition cars were finished in Suzuka Gray Metallic (LX7N), and other equipment includes Carbon Sigma side blades, parking sensors, Audi Sport graphics, and LED headlights and taillights. The 20″ Audi Sport milled-cut wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires measuring 245/30 up front and 305/30 out back. The Competition Package added three-way adjustable coilover suspension, and this example was ordered with optional Dynamic Steering. Braking is handled by silver-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled and ventilated ceramic-composite discs at each corner. The heated power-adjustable seats are trimmed in Black Nappa leather, and matching hide extends to the dashboard and door panels. The Competition Package added the Audi Exclusive Interior Stitching Package in Red, and carbon-fiber trim accents the cockpit. Amenities include a Bang & Olufsen sound system, keyless entry, automatic climate control, and an Audi MMI navigation system. The flat-bottom Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with a red centering stripe and frames a configurable Audi Virtual Cockpit display. The digital odometer indicates under 6k miles. The 5.2-liter V10 was factory rated at 602 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in June 2025. Power is sent to all four wheels through a seven-speed S Tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Factory equipment includes a Sport exhaust system. html:
This 2018 Audi R8 V10 Plus coupe is one of 10 equipped from the factory with the $34,175 Competition Package, all of which were finished in Suzuka Gray Metallic over Black Nappa leather. Power is provided by a 5.2-liter V10 that drives all four wheels through a seven-speed S tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Equipment includes the Black Optic and Full Leather packages as well as 20″ Audi Sport wheels, ceramic-composite brakes, a fixed carbon-fiber rear wing, Carbon Sigma side blades, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, and Audi Virtual Cockpit. The car remained with the original owner in North Carolina until 2025, and it now has under 6k miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this R8 Competition is now offered in Georgia with a screenshot of the window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title.

The Competition Package added a carbon-fiber aero kit with extended side sills, front dive planes, a front spoiler, a rear diffuser, and a fixed rear wing. All Competition cars were finished in Suzuka Gray Metallic (LX7N), and other equipment includes Carbon Sigma side blades, parking sensors, Audi Sport graphics, and LED headlights and taillights.

The 20″ Audi Sport milled-cut wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires measuring 245/30 up front and 305/30 out back. The Competition Package added three-way adjustable coilover suspension, and this example was ordered with optional Dynamic Steering. Braking is handled by silver-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled and ventilated ceramic-composite discs at each corner.

The heated power-adjustable seats are trimmed in Black Nappa leather, and matching hide extends to the dashboard and door panels. The Competition Package added the Audi Exclusive Interior Stitching Package in Red, and carbon-fiber trim accents the cockpit. Amenities include a Bang & Olufsen sound system, keyless entry, automatic climate control, and an Audi MMI navigation system.

The flat-bottom Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with a red centering stripe and frames a configurable Audi Virtual Cockpit display. The digital odometer indicates under 6k miles.

The 5.2-liter V10 was factory rated at 602 horsepower and 413 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in June 2025.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a seven-speed S Tronic dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a Quattro all-wheel-drive system. Factory equipment includes a Sport exhaust system.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
